DataElement.preferredName: First Accelerated Phase of Disease Occurrence Date Known Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes if the first accelerated phase of disease date was known or unknown.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Accelerated Phase of Disease Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._The phase of a disease characterized by laboratory and clinical findings that indicate rapid progression._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The phase of a disease characterized by laboratory and clinical findings that indicate rapid progression.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The phase of a disease characterized by laboratory and clinical findings that indicate rapid progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: . 2021-1-5 ak OK to release per WZ.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.:Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
